name: $\AA^\infty_\QQ$

proofs.integral: The ring $\QQ[x_1, x_2, \ldots]$ is a domain.
proofs.finite-dimensional: There is an infinite chain of prime ideals $(0) \subsetneq (x_1) \subsetneq (x_1, x_2) \subsetneq (x_1, x_2, x_3) \subsetneq \cdots$.
proofs.locally-noetherian: There is an infinite chain of ideals $(0) \subsetneq (x_1) \subsetneq (x_1, x_2) \subsetneq (x_1, x_2, x_3) \subsetneq \cdots$.

description: Infinite-dimensional affine space over the rational numbers, that is, the scheme $\Spec \QQ[x_1, x_2, \ldots]$.
